sen.j: 橘 公長（たちばな の きみなが、生没年未詳）は平安時代末期の橘氏の武将。
sen.e: TACHIBANA no Kiminaga (date of birth and death unknown) was busho (Japanese military commander) of the Tachibana clan in the end of the Heian period.

sen.j: 橘広相の次男の橘公材の九代後の子孫。
sen.e: He was the 9th generation descendant of TACHIBANA no Kimisai who was the second son of TACHIBANA no Hiromi.

sen.j: 父は橘公光（公重）、子に橘公忠、橘公業。
sen.e: His father was TACHIBANA no Kinmitsu (公光) (Kinshige[公重]) and his children were TACHIBANA no Kintada and TACHIBANA no Kiminari.
sen.cmt: 公光、公重の読み方不明です。

sen.j: 弓馬と知謀に優れていた。
sen.e: He was good at Kyuba (archery and equestrianism) and had a wide knowledge.

sen.j: 元々平知盛の家人であったが、治承4年（1180年）12月に平家を見限り、同僚であった加々美長清の仲介で源頼朝の麾下に入る。
sen.e: Although he was originally Kenin (a retainer) of TAIRA no Tomomori, he gave up on the Taira family on December 1180 and became to serve MINAMOTO no Yoritomo by an intermediation of Nagakiyo KAGAMI (加々美長清) who was his peer.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処。「加々美長清」の読み方不明です。

sen.j: 『吾妻鏡』12月19日条によると、粟田口で当時源為義の家人であった斎藤実盛と片切景重と喧嘩になった時、為義が朝廷に訴えず斎藤・片切を諫めた。
sen.e: According to the section of December 19 (old lunar calendar) of "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), when he got into a fight with Sanemori SAITO and Kageshige KATAGIRI who were Kenin of MINAMOTO no Temeyoshi in those days at Awataguchi, Tameyoshi did not report it to the Imperial Court but remonstrated with them.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: According to the article of December 19 of "Azuma Kagami" (The Mirror of the East), when he got into a fight with Sanemori SAITO and Kageshige KATAGIRI who were Kenin of MINAMOTO no Tameyoshi at that time at Awataguchi, Tameyoshi did not report it to the Imperial Court but remonstrated with them.
sen.cmt: sectionをarticleに変更、(old lunar calendar)表記を削除、ミススペル訂正しました。

sen.j: この事から、公長は源家への恩を忘れず、縁者を訪ねて遠江国に下向し、鎌倉へ向かったという。
sen.e: For this reason, Kiminaga did not forget a favor to the Minamoto family, and he went to the Totomi Province to visit relatives and left for Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処

sen.j: 「京に馴るるの輩」という事で頼朝に重用され、元暦元年（1184年）、平頼盛の帰洛にあたって餞別の宴に同席した。
sen.e: He was given an important post by Yoritomo as 'a person who knew Kyoto very well' and joined the farewell reception when TAIRA no Yorimori went back to Kyoto.

sen.j: その後源義経の下で戦った。
sen.e: After that, he fought under the command of MINAMOTO no Yoshitsune.

sen.j: 元暦2年（1185年）の壇ノ浦の戦い後、捕虜となった平家の総帥・平宗盛の処刑を担当し、その事と平重衡の最期について鎌倉の頼朝に報告した。
sen.e: After the Battle of Dan no ura in 1185, he was in charge of execution of TAIRA no Munemori who was the commander of the TAIRA family captured in battle and reported it and Shigehira's last to Yoritomo in Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文の例外対処
sen.e: After the Battle of Dan no ura in 1185, he was in charge of execution of TAIRA no Munemori who was the commander of the TAIRA family and was captured in the battle, and reported it and Shigehira's last to Yoritomo in Kamakura.
sen.cmt: 冠詞挿入、コンマ挿入しました。
sen.e: After the Battle of Dan no ura in 1185, he was in charge of execution of TAIRA no Munemori who was the commander of the TAIRA family and was captured in the battle, and reported it and Shigehira's last to Yoritomo in Kamakura.

sen.j: 『平家物語』「大臣殿被斬」によると、世の人々は公長がかつて平家の家人であったことを忘れず、その変わり身に多くの批判を浴びせたという。
sen.e: According to the section 'oitono-kirare' (a story that Munemori was executed in the 11th volume) in "Heike Monogatari" (The tale of the Heike), people did not forget that Kiminaga had been Kenin of the Taira family at one time and strongly criticized his change of mind.

sen.j: 子孫は肥前国に広がり、次男の公業が一時所領とした小鹿島（現秋田県男鹿市）の地名をとった小鹿島氏として繁栄した。
sen.e: His descendants widely lived in the Hizen Province and flourished as the Ogashima (小鹿島) clan named after the place name Ogashima (present Oga City, Akita Prefecture) which was temporarily the territory of his second son Kiminari.
sen.cmt: 小鹿島の読み方不明です。
